intro: Hieracium plicatum var. ivigtutense, commonly known as the Ivigtut hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Greenland. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils in Arctic and alpine environments. It has a low stature, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
